intro: Bryonia cretica var. monoica, commonly known as the single-flowered bryony, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and the Middle East. It is a member of the genus Bryonia in the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant produces yellow, bell-shaped flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. It has a trailing habit with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The fruit is a spiny, orange-colored capsule that contains toxic seeds.
